other_tests.findings: Sinus bradycardia (heart rate, 53/min), left ventricle (LV) hypertrophy by Sokolov-Lyon criteria, lateral and inferior T-wave inversions, and high-voltage QRS complexes.

LV ejection fraction of 66% with biventricular hypertrophy; LV concentric hypertrophy most notable at the posterior and lateral walls of the apex (1.7 cm), LV basal septum (1.3 cm), and LV basal posterior wall (1.1 cm); no resting left ventricular outflow tract (LVOT) gradient.
No evidence of fibrosis; normal perfusion and viability; increased trabeculations in the RV apex and in the lateral wall and apex of the LV.
Peak oxygen uptake at 13% of predicted; blunted chronotropic response (63% of predicted for age).

Mildly reduced cardiac output (3.67 L/min); elevated pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (16 mm Hg); tall A and V waves (24 mm Hg); pulmonary artery pressure (34/16 mm Hg; mean, 22 mm Hg); RV pressure (40/10 mm Hg); right atrial mean pressure (8 mm Hg) at the upper limit of normal.
Marked lactic aciduria (1,650.1 Î¼mol/mmol creatinine); elevated plasma lactate (3.9 mmol/L).
Pathogenic homozygous c.385G>A (p.Gly129Arg) mutation in the BCS1L gene.
